author: AddictedToStyrene
title: An astronaut
review: Yep, an astronaut. That's what you get. No surprises. A minifig with a space-backpack. It's a bigger backpack than you would expect for a 'science fiction' themed space set, but since this little guy goes with the space port, the size is realistic. A couple of these can be happily added to a space station or space port set up. Comes with spare joystick and lights. The gold visor is cool too.

author: mrmitch
title: LEGO shop at home exclusive !
review: This little guy was only available at LEGO stores or through the catalog for a short period of time. Cost was around $2.00 and he adds to the Space Port theme. Good set/good value to a cool theme. Recommend the man if you ever come across it today. Rate it a 4 due to the limited numbers of this set, good set to own as a collector.

author: absolutelylez
title: Cheap and Cheerful
review: This little set is one of my alltime favourites because he is so sweet! This cost me £1.50 from Tesco when it was released. There's a little golden grate on the back and a keyboard piece, very cool little additions.

author: pod120
title: First set I ever got
review:
This was what I believe the very first Lego set I ever got so I thought I better write a review for seeing it has been more than 10 years.

Pros:
-Includes many neat pieces for a set of its size
-Includes chrome gold face shield
-Box is almost a cube shape!
-NO STICKERS!

Cons:
-None

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Town (Space Port) - Astronaut Figure Review
review:
This is a good little set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has only 2 pages and we get no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has 18 pieces and it was 2 USD when it was on sale. That means that this model was 11 cents per piece which is a good value for what we get here.

Minifigures

This set has only one minifig. The figure has a white suit, a white helmet, a golden visor and a headset on the face.

The build

The build was very nice and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6457-1.jpg[/img]


This set has a very cool minifig which has a jetpack. The jetpack may doesn't do anything but it's very easy to put it on the back of the helmet. This piece looks very good on this figure, too.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
